Aplastic anemia is a disorder in which hematopoietic stem cells are severely diminished, resulting in hypocellular bone marrow and pancytopenia. All cell lines are involved. Autoimmune attack on stem cells is the most common identifiable cause. Other causes include toxins, ionizing radiation, drugs, nutritional deficiencies, and infections.
